publication.abstract: Â© The Author 2014. Published by Oxford University Press. All rights reserved. Genotype imputation is a key step in the analysis of genome-wide association studies. Upcoming very large reference panels, such as those from The 1000 Genomes Project and the Haplotype Consortium, will improve imputation quality of rare and less common variants, but will also increase the computational burden. Here, we demonstrate how the application of software engineering techniques can help to keep imputation broadly accessible. Overall, these improvements speed up imputation by an order of magnitude compared with our previous implementation.
publication.title: Minimac2: Faster genotype imputation

summary.description: Designed to work on phased genotypes and can handle very large reference panels with hundreds or thousands of haplotypes.
summary.name: minimac 2
